column4: is there a way I can get my username on linux, I forgot what it was since it's been set
ls -lA /home/ <- the user dirs are named after the users
unless you have a user without a home dir, but that's a highly unlikely configuration for a general-purpose user
why so?
as I said, use a live medium to identify the user's home folder, then you have the name
any live CD you can come up with
e.g.
but why 'another'?
no loss; burn another one ^^
after loading the disc what do I do afterwords
find out what partition contains your /home/ folder, mount that & look at it
if in doubt, just mount all partitions, doesn't hurt ;)

if you have only 1 partition, you will find a /home/ directory there containing the users' personal directories; if you have a separate partition for /home/, you will see the users' directories directly there
no, you boot from the CD
is that a live CD or an alternate CD?
wait a sec, I'll boot a live CD
it's an alternate CD, get a live CD
you need one that says 'desktop' in the filename
gotta grab some sleep, be back around 0900 UTC, just in the unlikely case you won't find other assistance here
right

nothing special, just start the live system (in your case likely: "Start Xubuntu"), wait till the desktop is there, then use file browser to look through the hard drive partitions to find either /home/ or the user dir(s) (in the former case the user dir(s) will be in /home/)
you on
obviously ;)
I am wanting my computer to autologin. I am at the login screen settings but it will not allow me to choose myself to autologin, how do I fix this
